newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Finmeccanica names new chairman.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Finmeccanica names new chairman.

text.p: Italian state engineering company Finmeccanica said on Thursday it had named Sergio Carbone as its new chairman and Alberto Lina as vice chairman and chief operating officer.
The group announced the new appointments in a statement. Bruno Steve was confirmed as managing director. Gaetano Golinelli and Gianfranco Zanda also join the board.

Fabiano Fabiani, one of the last grandees of Italian industry, resigned as chairman in April after the group's parent company, state holding Iri, ordered him to reverse his strategy of bringing the Finmeccanica empire under one umbrella.

In a damning condemnation of the management, Iri had ordered that debt-ridden Finmeccanica, one of Italy's biggest industrial concerns, be split into separate divisions controlled by a single holding company.

Finmeccanica's privatisation is pencilled in for 1998 and IRI, which owns a little over 60 percent of the group, has not yet decided whether to sell off the firm's defence, aerospace, energy and transport divisions separately.
Finmeccanica had debt of 6.59 trillion lire at the end of March compared with 5.1 trillion at end-1996 and made a 540.4 billion lire 1996 loss after a 1995 profit of 40 billion lire.
